intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. duciformis, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with 5 to 10 petals, which are typically borne on long, hairy stems. The plant has palmately divided leaves that are deeply lobed, often with a waxy coating. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, marshes, and along stream banks. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
